THIS WHITE STAR ANT) ASSOCIATO^MOTS,,, Memorandum by the Chancellor of the Exchequer. (Circulated with reference to G.T.^596)In connection with Sir J. i aclay's memorandum I wish to draw attention to the fact that the exercise of the pre-emption right may not be practicable. I assume that if the ri ^h.t is exercised cash payment willbe required.If this caBh were dollars, they would be unobtainable; if sterling, the payment would be a burden to the Exchange which I could hardly contemplate,I agree that-proposals for taking positive action at this moment should be resisted by the Shipping Controller.(Intd) A.C,Treasury S.W.8th July 1919,
